articles.author: Richard Gray
articles.title: How the Moon is making days longer on Earth - BBC
articles.description: Billions of years ago the average Earth day lasted less than 13 hours and it is continuing to lengthen. The reason lies in the relationship between the Moon and our oceans.
articles.content:
So, could we eventually have a future where the Earth no longer has a Moon?
Even at its high current rate of retreat, the Moon is unlikely to ever leave the Earth entirely. The Sun's own calamitous … [+1704 chars]

articles.title: Galactic Explosion Reveals New Details About the Universe - SciTechDaily
articles.description: New research sheds light on the chemical formation of the universe. An international team of researchers stumbled upon an exploding supernova in a distant spiral galaxy, using data from the first year of interstellar observation by the James Webb Space Telesc…
articles.content:
ByTatyana Woodall, Ohio State UniversityMarch 3, 2023
Many chemical elements are formed during a supernova explosion, so studying them can give scientists insight into the universes chemical make-up… [+6803 chars]
